snippet: A study casts doubt on the life sentence, as the population of aging inmates continues to swell, along with the cost of keeping them locked up.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column cites report by inmate advocacy organization Osborne Assn that casts doubt on life sentence as population of aging inmates continues to swell, along with costs of keeping elderly locked up; notes study comes at same time as two reports that underscore need for changes to way young prisoners in New York prisons are treated, as well as detrimental effects of use of solitary confinement.
lead_paragraph: A study casts doubt on the life sentence, as the population of aging inmates continues to swell, along with the cost of keeping them locked up.

headline.main: Unkind Life for Young and Old
headline.print_headline: Unkind Life for Young and Old
